Or better yet, make that person through this poorly acted, fright-free remake of the 1979 movie of the same name. Camilla Belle is a looker, but she got nothing on Carol Kane, the actress who originally played the part, when it comes to range. The final straw is that the payoff isn't worth the tedium that comes before. Just hang up on this one.

tt1131734.plot: A newly possessed high school cheerleader turns into a succubus who specializes in killing her male classmates. Can her best friend put an end to the horror?

tt0120780.tomato_consensus: Steven Soderbergh's intelligently crafted adaptation of the Elmore Leonard novel is witty, sexy, suprisingly entertaining, and a star-making turn for George Clooney.

tt3236120.plot: A widow and former songstress discovers that life can begin anew at any age.

tt1862079.actors: Aubrey Plaza, Lauren Carlos, Basil Harris, Mary Lynn Rajskub
tt1862079.plot: Three magazine employees head out on an assignment to interview a guy who placed a classified advertisement seeking a companion for time travel.

tt2294449.actors: Jonah Hill, Channing Tatum, Peter Stormare, Wyatt Russell

tt0102181.plot: Writer Franz Kafka works during the day at an insurance company where events lead him to discover a mysterious underground society with strange suppressive goals.

tt0165854.tomato_consensus: Crafted with eccentric moodiness and style by Steven Soderbergh, The Limey is also a gritty neo-noir showcase for the talent of leading man Terence Stamp.
tt0165854.title: The Limey
tt0165854.actors: Terence Stamp, Lesley Ann Warren, Luis Guzmán, Barry Newman
tt0165854.plot: An extremely volatile and dangerous Englishman goes to Los Angeles to find the man he considers responsible for his daughter's death.

tt0045897.title: I Confess
tt0045897.writer: George Tabori (screen play), William Archibald (screen play), Paul Anthelme (from a play by)
tt0045897.actors: Montgomery Clift, Anne Baxter, Karl Malden, Brian Aherne
tt0045897.plot: A priest who comes under suspicion for murder cannot clear his name without breaking the seal of the confessional.

tt0079271.title: Hardcore
tt0079271.actors: George C. Scott, Peter Boyle, Season Hubley, Dick Sargent
tt0079271.plot: A conservative Midwest businessman ventures into the sordid underworld of pornography in California to look for his runaway teenage daughter who is making porno films in California's porno pits.

tt2350496.tomato_consensus: Warm, affectionate, and sweet but not cloying, The Lunchbox is a clever crowd-pleaser from first-time director Ritesh Batra.
tt2350496.title: The Lunchbox
tt2350496.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 28 wins & 35 nominations.
tt2350496.writer: Ritesh Batra (screenplay), Vasan Bala (hindi dialogue consultant)
tt2350496.actors: Irrfan Khan, Nimrat Kaur, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Lillete Dubey
tt2350496.plot: A mistaken delivery in Mumbai's famously efficient lunchbox delivery system connects a young housewife to an older man in the dusk of his life as they build a fantasy world together through notes in the lunchbox.

tt1211890.tomato_consensus: Wise, compassionate, and beautifully acted, Middle of Nowhere offers an early testament to writer-director Ava DuVernay's startling talent.
tt1211890.title: Middle of Nowhere
tt1211890.actors: Emayatzy Corinealdi, Omari Hardwick, Edwina Findley Dickerson, Sharon Lawrence
tt1211890.plot: When her husband is sentenced to eight years in prison, Ruby drops out of medical school in order to focus on her husband's well-being while he's incarcerated - leading her on a journey of self-discovery in the process.

tt0283632.tomato_consensus: They fails to sustain the level of creepiness necessary to rise above other movies in the horror genre.
tt0283632.title: They
tt0283632.actors: Laura Regan, Marc Blucas, Ethan Embry, Dagmara Dominczyk
tt0283632.plot: A psychology student finds all her childhood fears and phobias becoming real after a traumatic event.

tt0119280.tomato_consensus: Thanks to some top notch acting, the chemistry between its stars, and a witty, thoughtful script, Mrs. Brown delivers a nuanced and entertaining, if not entirely factual, account of a seldom explored historical relationship.
tt0119280.title: Mrs Brown
tt0119280.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 12 wins & 22 nominations.
tt0119280.actors: Judi Dench, Billy Connolly, Geoffrey Palmer, Antony Sher
tt0119280.plot: Queen Victoria is deeply depressed after the death of her husband, disappearing from public. Her servant Brown, who adores her, through caress and admiration brings her back to life, but ...

tt0081568.title: The Stunt Man
tt0081568.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 4 wins & 8 nominations.
tt0081568.writer: Lawrence B. Marcus (screenplay), Richard Rush (adaptation), Paul Brodeur (novel)
tt0081568.actors: Peter O'Toole, Steve Railsback, Barbara Hershey, Allen Garfield
tt0081568.plot: A fugitive stumbles on a movie set just when they need a new stunt man, takes the job as a way to hide out, and falls for the leading lady.

tt0081283.tomato_consensus: Though shot through with bitterness and sorrow, Robert Redford's directorial debut is absorbing and well-acted.
tt0081283.title: Ordinary People
tt0081283.actors: Donald Sutherland, Mary Tyler Moore, Judd Hirsch, Timothy Hutton
tt0081283.plot: The accidental death of the older son of an affluent family deeply strains the relationships among the bitter mother, the good-natured father, and the guilt-ridden younger son.

tt0811080.tomato_consensus: The Wachowski Brothers have overloaded Speed Racer with headache-inducing special effects, and neglected to develop a coherent storyline.
tt0811080.title: Speed Racer
tt0811080.writer: Lilly Wachowski, Lana Wachowski, Tatsuo Yoshida (animated series "Speed Racer")
tt0811080.actors: Emile Hirsch, Nicholas Elia, Susan Sarandon, Melissa Holroyd
tt0811080.plot: A young driver, Speed Racer, aspires to be champion of the racing world with the help of his family and his high-tech Mach 5 automobile.

tt0047849.title: Bad Day at Black Rock
tt0047849.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 3 wins & 5 nominations.
tt0047849.writer: Millard Kaufman (screen play), Don McGuire (adaptation), Howard Breslin (based on a story by)
tt0047849.actors: Spencer Tracy, Robert Ryan, Anne Francis, Dean Jagger
tt0047849.plot: A one-handed stranger comes to a tiny town possessing a terrible past they want to keep secret, by violent means if necessary.

tt1233334.tomato_consensus: Pulsing with authenticity and led by a stirring lead performance from Adepero Oduye, Pariah is a powerful coming out/coming-of-age film that signals the arrival of a fresh new talent in writer/director Dee Rees.
tt1233334.title: Pariah
tt1233334.actors: Adepero Oduye, Pernell Walker, Aasha Davis, Charles Parnell
tt1233334.plot: A Brooklyn teenager juggles conflicting identities and risks friendship, heartbreak, and family in a desperate search for sexual expression.

tt0458525.tomato_consensus: Though Hugh Jackman gives his all, he can't help X-Men Origins: Wolverine overcome a cliche-ridden script and familiar narrative.
tt0458525.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
tt0458525.actors: Hugh Jackman, Liev Schreiber, Danny Huston, Will.i.am
tt0458525.plot: A look at Wolverine's early life, in particular his time with the government squad Team X and the impact it will have on his later years.

tt1583420.tomato_consensus: Despite the relaxed, easy chemistry of stars Tom Hanks and Julia Roberts, Larry Crowne is surprisingly bland and conventional.
tt1583420.title: Larry Crowne
tt1583420.actors: Tom Hanks, Sarah Mahoney, Roxana Ortega, Randall Park
tt1583420.plot: After losing his job, a middle-aged man reinvents himself by going back to college.

tt0103594.title: 1492: Conquest of Paradise
tt0103594.awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 nomination.
tt0103594.actors: Gérard Depardieu, Armand Assante, Sigourney Weaver, Loren Dean
tt0103594.plot: Christopher Columbus' discovery of the Americas and the effect this has on the indigenous people.

tt1276104.tomato_consensus: As thought-provoking as it is thrilling, Looper delivers an uncommonly smart, bravely original blend of futuristic sci-fi and good old-fashioned action.
tt1276104.title: Looper
tt1276104.actors: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Bruce Willis, Emily Blunt, Paul Dano
tt1276104.plot: In 2074, when the mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent into the past, where a hired gun awaits - someone like Joe - who one day learns the mob wants to 'close the loop' by sending back Joe's future self for assassination.
